check_box.name: automatic_fly
check_box.label: Auto fly/land on holding PgUp/PgDown (or up/down controls)

check_box.name: arrow_keys_move_avatar_check
check_box.label: Arrow keys always move avatar, even when typing in chat bar
check_box.tool_tip: When this setting is checked, the arrow keys always move the avatar around even when some text is already typed in the chat bar, but then you cannot move the cursor in the text of the chat bar with the left and right keys, which can be a nuisance when correcting typos (you yet still can position the cursor with the mouse)

radio_item.name: dc_no_operation
radio_item.tool_tip: With this option selected, in-world double-clicks will have no effect (unless you click on a touch-script object, of course).

radio_item.name: dc_auto_pilot
radio_item.tool_tip: If this option is selected, each time you double-click in-world on the floor, the viewer will attempt to auto-pilot your avatar to the clicked location.

radio_item.name: dc_teleport
radio_item.tool_tip: If this option is selected, each time you double-click in-world, the viewer will attempt to teleport your avatar to the clicked location.

check_box.name: double_click_scripted_object_check
check_box.label: Auto-pilot or Teleport to double-clicked script-touch objects
check_box.tool_tip: When this setting is checked, double-clicks on script-touch objects (scripted objects with a touch event) also trigger an auto-pilot or teleport action (as set above). This can be an annoyance since some scripted objects might use double-clicks for their own benefit (and you won't want to go/TP to the object each time you use their double-click feature), and even for simple touch scripted object it will trigger their touch action twice on auto-pilot/TP double-click requests.

slider.name: camera_to_pelvis_max_rot
slider.label: Head/Pelvis Max Rotation Deviation
slider.tool_tip: While your avatar is standing, using the right and left controls first changes the camera rotation (as well as the avatar head so that it faces the new focus point) and once the 'Head/Pelvis Max Rotation' threshold is reached, the controls then move the avatar, rotating its pelvis to stay below that threshold value. Reducing this threshold allows more accurate rotation movements of your avatar but makes its head movements a tad less 'natural' while rotating in a standing position.

check_box.name: camera_ignore_collisions
check_box.label: Do not move the camera out of objects on collision
check_box.tool_tip: When the following-up position of the camera would cause the latter to collide with or enter an object, the camera is normally automatically 'pushed' towards the avatar till the surface of the colliding object is behind it. This may cause spurious zoom-in/zoom-out camera movements when colliding with transparent objects or with objects which bounding box is much larger than their actual, visible size (this is the case with many sculpties, for example). Checking this setting prevents the automatic move to happen, letting you the responsibility to zoom-in yourself (with the mouse scroll wheel, for example) and as you deem appropriate.

check_box.name: edit_camera_movement
check_box.label: Automatic Edit Camera Movement
check_box.tool_tip: Use automatic camera positioning when entering and exiting edit mode

check_box.name: edit_camera_movement
check_box.label: Automatic Appearance Camera Movement
check_box.tool_tip: Use automatic camera positioning while in avatar appearance edit mode

check_box.name: front_camera_on_sit
check_box.label: Automatically switch to front camera view on sitting
check_box.tool_tip: Automatically switch the camera to the front view when your avatar sits down on an object, and automatically disable the front view on standing up.

check_box.name: use_max_rot_in_mouselook
check_box.label: Use the above Head/Pelvis Max Deviation in mouselook
check_box.tool_tip: When this this setting is enabled, the 'Head/Pelvis Max Rotation' threshold set by the slider above is also taken into account in Mouselook mode instead of using the default (and large) threshold value: this makes your avatar rotate sooner when moving the mouselook camera left and right.
